item.description:
Merrimack Valley 911 Truth is proud to be a supporter of the local area showing of Loose Change Final Cut, which is being brought to the Colonial Theater in Keene by our friends at Student Scholars for 911 Truth.

This is the NorthEast premiere showing and the filmmakers, Dylan Avery and Jason Bermas will we there!

Mark your calendar - carpool arrangements are shown below for those who'd like to ride over together and share the camaraderie. This will be a great opportunity for you to bring friends and family members who have questions about the events of 9/11/01.

A portion of the proceeds will be donated to the FealGood Foundation, for the benefit of First Responders' families. John Feal, a 911 first-responder will be there to talk about why he formed the Fealgood Foundation.

"The primary mission of the FealGood Foundation, a non-profit organization, is to spread awareness and educate the public about the catastrophic health effects on 9/11 first responders, as well as to provide assistance to relieve these great heroes of the financial burdens placed on them over the last five years. A secondary goal of our Foundation is to create a network of advocacy on 9/11 healthcare issues. We not only advocate for Ground Zero workers, but show others how they can advocate for themselves and help others through grassroots activism."

-------------------------
CARPOOL DETAILS:
(as of noon, day of event)

From Concord and points north:
call Charles for details @ 748-1758

From Manchester:
looking for a carpool coordinator for Manchester

From Nashua:
Meet at the parking lot of the 155 Main Dunstable Road medical building.
Meetup time: 4:50, depart at 5:00 PM (call Jack for details: 233-1058)

from Amherst:
Meet at the Amherst Town Library
Meetup time: 5:05 PM, depart at 5:15

-------------------------
Downloadable flyer:

see our files area.
item.name: Loose Change Final Cut - Keene
